Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

At HubSpot, we aim to help businesses grow better every day. We are looking for highly skilled Data Analysts to join our team!

Job Summary

We have a number of Analyst positions open at various levels of seniority across a range of focus areas, including; EMEA Sales Strategy & Operations, Global / EMEA Sales & Marketing Planning, Global Insights & Analytics and Global Partner / Channel Strategy & Operations.

In these roles you will be combining deep data insights with business expertise to deliver comprehensive solutions that tackle critical challenges and enhance both operational efficiency and strategic outcomes. Some of our analyst roles are more specialised. Our recruitment team will help match your experience to these roles and determine the best fit.

About The Team

Revenue Operations partners with GTM leadership to drive daily business and achieve long-term strategic priorities. We use a data-driven approach to solve complex issues and drive business planning from strategy to execution.

Key Responsibilities


Be the go-to expert for the business, playing a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making
Participate in and develop the analyst community, fostering a high-performing, insights-driven culture
Be hands-on, delivering critical insights that shape strategic decisions and ensure data is at the core of our operations
Partner with leadership to drive business strategy, planning, goal-setting, and performance tracking
Scope and lead high-impact projects and execute on mission-critical strategic initiatives


These roles offer significant exposure to HubSpot C-suite and growth opportunities. If you thrive in a high-impact, strategic role and want to shape the future of the business, we’d love to hear from you.

Qualifications


A minimum number of years experience in a sales strategy role or equivalent level position:
Analyst - Min. 2 Years
Senior Analyst - 4+ Years
Demonstrated expertise in analytical or modeling techniques using tools like Looker, Hex, or Google Suite.
Strong aptitude for defining key metrics and conducting analyses to derive actionable insights.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with a proven track record of presenting to revenue-driven executives.
Strong capability to identify personal and professional growth opportunities and willingness to expand beyond baseline responsibilities.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite, Google Apps, Salesforce.com, and HubSpot CRM.
Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
Python or R is a plus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous working environment.


We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee, or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers.

If you are joining our Engineering team in a full-time role, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as HubSpot’s annual PEER week, your Product Group Summit, and other in-person gatherings to continue building on those connections.

If you require an accommodation due to travel limitations or other reasons, please inform your recruiter during the hiring process. We are committed to supporting candidates who may need alternative arrangements.

Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.

India Applicants: link to HubSpot India's equal opportunity policy here.

About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022 and has been recognized for its award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees across the globe work remotely and in HubSpot offices. Visit our careers website to learn more about the culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.
Show more
HTML:
Company Overview

At HubSpot, we aim to help businesses grow better every day. We are looking for highly skilled Data Analysts to join our team!

Job Summary

We have a number of Analyst positions open at various levels of seniority across a range of focus areas, including; EMEA Sales Strategy & Operations, Global / EMEA Sales & Marketing Planning, Global Insights & Analytics and Global Partner / Channel Strategy & Operations.

In these roles you will be combining deep data insights with business expertise to deliver comprehensive solutions that tackle critical challenges and enhance both operational efficiency and strategic outcomes. Some of our analyst roles are more specialised. Our recruitment team will help match your experience to these roles and determine the best fit.

About The Team

Revenue Operations partners with GTM leadership to drive daily business and achieve long-term strategic priorities. We use a data-driven approach to solve complex issues and drive business planning from strategy to execution.

Key Responsibilities

  • Be the go-to expert for the business, playing a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making
  • Participate in and develop the analyst community, fostering a high-performing, insights-driven culture
  • Be hands-on, delivering critical insights that shape strategic decisions and ensure data is at the core of our operations
  • Partner with leadership to drive business strategy, planning, goal-setting, and performance tracking
  • Scope and lead high-impact projects and execute on mission-critical strategic initiatives

These roles offer significant exposure to HubSpot C-suite and growth opportunities. If you thrive in a high-impact, strategic role and want to shape the future of the business, we’d love to hear from you.

Qualifications

  • A minimum number of years experience in a sales strategy role or equivalent level position:
    • Analyst - Min. 2 Years
    • Senior Analyst - 4+ Years
    • Demonstrated expertise in analytical or modeling techniques using tools like Looker, Hex, or Google Suite.
    • Strong aptitude for defining key metrics and conducting analyses to derive actionable insights.
    • Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with a proven track record of presenting to revenue-driven executives.
    • Strong capability to identify personal and professional growth opportunities and willingness to expand beyond baseline responsibilities.
    • Proficiency with MS Office Suite, Google Apps, Salesforce.com, and HubSpot CRM.
    • Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
    • Python or R is a plus.
    • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous working environment.

    We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

    If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

    At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee, or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers.

    If you are joining our Engineering team in a full-time role, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as HubSpot’s annual PEER week, your Product Group Summit, and other in-person gatherings to continue building on those connections.

    If you require an accommodation due to travel limitations or other reasons, please inform your recruiter during the hiring process. We are committed to supporting candidates who may need alternative arrangements.

    Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.

    India Applicants: link to HubSpot India's equal opportunity policy here.

    About HubSpot

    HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

    You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022 and has been recognized for its award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

    Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees across the globe work remotely and in HubSpot offices. Visit our careers website to learn more about the culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

    By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.

Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.



Role Overview:

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst to integrate an international project in the corporate banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in Europe, with activity in over 75 countries around the world, it also counts with over 175 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry.


What you will do:

You will be part of an international and diverse team supporting the Global Markets Front Office in understanding their clients, identifying opportunities, and uncovering trends through data analysis. Your role will involve working closely with various business areas within the bank, providing valuable insights to drive business growth by understanding their needs and implementing data-driven solutions, including analysis, visualization, and automation. You will be responsible for retrieving, preparing, and analyzing complex datasets using statistical models and best practices in data visualization to create reports and develop automated tools that support strategic decision-making. Additionally, you will bridge technical and non-technical areas, ensuring clear communication between stakeholders and the technical team by translating business needs into technical requirements and effectively presenting complex analysis results.


What you are like:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields;
  • Experience in data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus;
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus;
  • Strong organizational and planning skills;
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Proficiency in English (mandatory).


Why join us

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients;
  • Learn more about emerging technologies;
  • Possibility of working remotely;
  • Design your career plan;
  • Access to continuous training and certifications;
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program;

… and much more!

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
Junior Analyst

Processing data is our core business. We use data to develop, train, and implement models while creating a deeper understanding of business processes for our clients. We believe that data should never be processed in isolation or without the proper context. That’s why we provide contextual analytics—taking into account what the data represents, rather than just analyzing numbers or text stored in a file or database.

And yes, we also develop and train AI/ML models, but only if they add value to what our clients expect from us.

Role

As a Junior Analyst, you will work closely with senior analysts and managers to collect, process, and define data for various projects. This involves conducting detailed data analyses to determine data quality, performing fit-for-purpose assessments, and designing and implementing data pipelines.

To ensure high-quality and meaningful results, you will continuously validate outputs and underlying assumptions. This is achieved by reviewing relevant documentation and discussing findings with internal or client subject matter experts.

Key Responsibilities:

Extract, process, and classify data from structured sources
Develop models to extract data from unstructured sources
Build models to forecast (financial) metrics
Create key metrics to identify patterns and insights
Develop dashboards for (senior) management
Define implementation strategies for productionizing analyses

What We Offer

We value individual contributions and encourage professional growth. We enjoy working together and learning from each other. Our clients benefit from our expertise, and our colleagues develop as professionals.

Our assignments are challenging and diverse, meaning no two days, projects, or clients are the same.

Benefits:

Competitive salary with a bonus scheme
Hybrid & flexible working options, plus 30 vacation days
A young, dynamic, and diverse team with passion and ambition
Two additional leave days per year for volunteering
Choice of a company car or public transport card
Laptop, phone, and internet allowance (also for personal use)

Your Profile

We are looking for ambitious individuals with a strong understanding of mathematics and its applications. You should have an intrinsic drive to learn and understand business processes, as well as the ability to analyze and interpret data in a meaningful way.

Education:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Economics, or Quantitative Finance

Required Skills:

Basic programming knowledge (Python, R, SQL)
Ability to design and implement mathematical models
Strong foundation in statistical analysis

Title: Data Analyst (Data&Analytics, Freshful Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!



As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant insights and recommendations to support business decisions and goals.



What you’ll have to do:

  • Gather and aggregate relevant data from various sources, such as internal Databases, Google Analytics and BigQuery, Business Intelligence resources;
  • Analyze complex user datasets using data visualization and statistical tools;
  • Analyze user behavior data to identify patterns, preferences, and potential areas for improvement;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate insights effectively to stakeholders;
  • Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data integrity, quality, and accessibility for analysis purposes;
  • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in e-commerce analytics and user behavior analysis.


What makes you a good fit:

  • Have 1+ years experience as a Data Analyst or similar positions;
  • Have SQL experience;
  • Have experience with at least one data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI);
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex datasets;
  • Able to translate business problems into quantitative analyses and produce useful insights;
  • Have excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate effectively with teams;
  • Able to work independently;
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).


What makes you stand out:

  • Have strong understanding of e-commerce KPIs and user behavior analysis methodologies;
  • Knowledge of Pyhton;
  • Experience of working within structured and Agile project environments;
  • University degree in Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience.


What we’ve prepared for you:

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Boost your Career!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Boost your Career!

Gain hands-on experience from day one
Work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau




Are you a data-driven professional eager to accelerate your career? This is your chance to join a well-established Irish-owned company that prioritizes professional growth and long-term career development.




We’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst with 1–3 years of experience in data analysis who is ready to take the next step in their career. You’ll work across multiple business functions, turning complex data into meaningful insights that drive strategic decision-making.




Under the mentorship of a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows, refining your skills in SQL and data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau. This is the perfect opportunity to develop into a Senior Data Analyst while making an impact from day one!




You will:

Analyse large, complex datasets to generate valuable business insights.
Gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows.
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decisions.
Receive direct mentorship and guidance from a Senior Data Analyst.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Experience in data extraction, transformation, and reporting using SQL.




Salary / Remuneration:

€25,000 - €40,000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie




I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

About Archer – Archer Recruitment is a Specialist IT Recruitment

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support financial and regulatory reporting. You will work with large datasets, optimize data processing, and ensure compliance with financial regulations. This role requires strong SQL skills to analyze and transform data, but it is not a hardcore programming position. You will collaborate with Business Analysts, Data Engineers, and Reporting Specialists to deliver accurate financial reports.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process financial datasets for regulatory reporting.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and structuring.
Ensure data quality, resolve discrepancies, and validate reporting outcomes.
Translate reporting requirements into structured data attributes.
Support compliance with IFRS, Basel III/IV, Solvency II, ECB/EBA regulations.




What We Are Looking For:

3+ years of experience in data, finance, or IT analysis.
Strong SQL skills (MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Experience with data warehousing, ETL, and financial reporting tools.
Experience with Power BI is a plus.




What's in for you:

A challenging large-scale project.
International work environment and collaborative colleagues.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Company: Bitcoinsensus

Location: Fully Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time Contractor




About Us:




Bitcoinsensus is a leading entity in the cryptocurrency space, committed to sharing knowledge through multiple social media platforms and our website. We’re focused on real-time market analysis, comprehensive guides, and insightful reviews, serving a diverse audience ranging from blockchain and crypto beginners to experts.

Role Overview:




We’re seeking a skilled Data Analyst who can turn raw data into actionable insights. The role requires a deep understanding of how to work with complex datasets, identify trends, and communicate key findings to influence strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities




Collect, clean, and interpret large datasets to uncover actionable insights.
Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Mixpanel, Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business growth.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define KPIs and measure performance.
Support data-driven decision-making processes by providing clear and concise recommendations.
Provide key reports, trends & insights that will enable the business to implement strategic & commercial decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across projects.

Qualifications & Skills




Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
A commercial mindset and understanding on how to translate data & insights into critical business & commercial decisions
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Excellent communication skills to convey insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What We Offer

Salary that is based on your experience and skill set
Fully remote work setting

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leader in the Tech industry, is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Global Operations Quality Analytics team in Dublin. This is a full-time, 11-month contract. The work schedule will be fully remote from Ireland.




Role Overview:

Global Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues and are strong advocates for our community.




On the Global Operations Quality team we measure how effectively the organisation is creating safe and open environments for our users and positive experiences for businesses across our family of apps through our suite of Quality metrics. We use this information to design & drive continuous improvement processes across our organization. We are looking for an analytical thinker with strong communication and creative problem-solving skills.




In this role you will work closely with cross-functional partners, subject matter experts, operations managers and our engineering and reporting teams and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting large datasets to extract meaningful insights and generate reports that inform business decisions, utilizing statistical methods and data visualization tools.




Responsibilities:

Performing statistical analysis on data using techniques like regression, hypothesis testing, and time series analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Creating compelling visual representations of data using charts, graphs, and dashboards to effectively communicate insights to non-technical audiences.
Developing and delivering comprehensive reports that summarize key findings and actionable insights to relevant stakeholders.
Creating, maintaining and optimizing datasets to ensure data integrity and efficient access.
Working closely with cross functional partners to understand their data needs and provide relevant analysis to support decision-making.




Required Skills:

Expertise in data visualization tools (SQL, Tableau, Power BI)
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Statistical knowledge and ability to interpret complex data sets
Clear and concise communication of technical findings to non-technical audiences
Ability to present data insights effectively through reports and presentations
Report process, policy and product concepts effectively to senior leadership, business and cross-functional partners by simplifying complex problems
Proactively and independently initiate and execute implementation plans and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to write clean, efficient, and scalable queries and code




Minimum Qualifications

5+ years working in an Analytics team, preferably in a technology company or consulting firm or similar fast-paced environment
5+ years experience delivering presentations to key stakeholders
5+ years professional experience with Excel (PivotTable, Charts, Statistical functions)
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python




Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, analytics, statistics or economics
Experience in program and stakeholder management in a cross-functional and cross geographical capacity




**Please note that this is a 11-month contract role**

Show more
HTML:
Our client, a leader in the Tech industry, is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Global Operations Quality Analytics team in Dublin. This is a full-time, 11-month contract. The work schedule will be fully remote from Ireland.


Role Overview:

Global Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues and are strong advocates for our community.


On the Global Operations Quality team we measure how effectively the organisation is creating safe and open environments for our users and positive experiences for businesses across our family of apps through our suite of Quality metrics. We use this information to design & drive continuous improvement processes across our organization. We are looking for an analytical thinker with strong communication and creative problem-solving skills.


In this role you will work closely with cross-functional partners, subject matter experts, operations managers and our engineering and reporting teams and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting large datasets to extract meaningful insights and generate reports that inform business decisions, utilizing statistical methods and data visualization tools.


Responsibilities:

  • Performing statistical analysis on data using techniques like regression, hypothesis testing, and time series analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
  • Creating compelling visual representations of data using charts, graphs, and dashboards to effectively communicate insights to non-technical audiences.
  • Developing and delivering comprehensive reports that summarize key findings and actionable insights to relevant stakeholders.
  • Creating, maintaining and optimizing datasets to ensure data integrity and efficient access.
  • Working closely with cross functional partners to understand their data needs and provide relevant analysis to support decision-making.


Required Skills:

  • Expertise in data visualization tools (SQL, Tableau, Power BI)
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Statistical knowledge and ability to interpret complex data sets
  • Clear and concise communication of technical findings to non-technical audiences
  • Ability to present data insights effectively through reports and presentations
  • Report process, policy and product concepts effectively to senior leadership, business and cross-functional partners by simplifying complex problems
  • Proactively and independently initiate and execute implementation plans and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
  • Ability to write clean, efficient, and scalable queries and code


Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years working in an Analytics team, preferably in a technology company or consulting firm or similar fast-paced environment
  • 5+ years experience delivering presentations to key stakeholders
  • 5+ years professional experience with Excel (PivotTable, Charts, Statistical functions)
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python


Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, analytics, statistics or economics
  • Experience in program and stakeholder management in a cross-functional and cross geographical capacity


**Please note that this is a 11-month contract role**

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Brillio

Brillio LLC is a fast-growing, pure-play Digital Transformation Solutions and Services company backed by Bain Capital private equity. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Silicon Valley, Brillio is focused on delivering design-led solutions for our customers. We are not an IT Services company trying to pivot and support the “next big thing.” As a digitally native company, everything we have done and will continue to do, will have this laser focus. Brillio delivers disruptive digital solutions across capabilities such as Design Thinking, Product Engineering, Data Analytics, Digital Front Office, and Digital Infrastructure. Our core values of Customer success, We Care, Entrepreneurial (mind set) and Excellence - drive everything that we do, from the very first day.




Brillio Romania

Brillio Romania is a dynamic and rapidly growing company with over 190 employees and offices in Cluj, Oradea, and Bucharest. With its fast-paced growth, the company has consistently demonstrated an unwavering commitment to client satisfaction.

At Brillio Romania, we know our success comes from the innovative contributions and brilliant work of our people. So, we make fostering a positive work environment our top priority. Employees at Brillio Romania not only thrive, but they also have the chance to build long and fulfilling careers, fostering a sense of stability and dedication that ultimately benefits both the company and our valued clients.




Role Overview

We are seeking a Data Analyst to support the development and evaluation of ML-driven pricing and personalization solutions. This role involves conducting data analysis, designing experiments, and providing insights to enhance machine learning models. The Data Analyst will collaborate with ML Scientists, Data Engineers, and Product Managers to drive data-driven experimentation and decision-making. The ideal candidate has a strong background in statistical analysis, experiment design, and data science workflows. This position requires working hours that overlap with the US Pacific Time (PST), specifically from 14:00 to 22:00 Romania time.




Key Responsibilities

Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), hypothesis testing, and statistical modelling to support ML and business objectives
Develop dashboards and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, or Seaborn to track key metrics, experiment outcomes, and model performance
Perform deep-dive analyses on specific datasets or business problems, providing actionable insights for strategic decision-making
Design, execute, and interpret A/B tests, multivariate experiments, and other controlled tests to evaluate the effectiveness of ML models
Work closely with ML Scientists, Data Engineers, and Product Managers to align on experiment goals and implement data-driven solutions




Requirements

Availability to work US hours, with an overlap in Pacific Time (PST) from 14:00 to 22:00 Romania time
3 to 4 years of experience in data analysis, experimentation analysis, or a related role supporting ML projects
Strong understanding of statistical methods, hypothesis testing, causal inference, and experiment design
Proficiency in Python for data manipulation, with experience using Pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn
Ability to write complex SQL queries including Window Functions, Joins, and Group By operations
Familiarity with ML techniques like Classification, Regression, and Clustering
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, or Seaborn
Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests and multivariate experiments to draw actionable insights
Experience working with large, complex datasets, including preprocessing and feature engineering




Nice to Have

Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure for handling large datasets
Familiarity with automated experimentation frameworks
Experience with causal inference techniques to drive data-driven decisions
Understanding of pricing strategies and personalization models in an ML context




Benefits

Fixed benefits:

Flexible working hours and a hybrid model.
We value your time and lifestyle preferences, so you can choose whether you want to work entirely remotely or from our offices in Cluj-Napoca, Oradea, and Bucharest.
Sports benefit
We encourage you to have a healthy lifestyle. We'll reimburse you a maximum of 150 lei/month from your favourite sporting activity: whether it's football, climbing, gym or other sports.
Private health insurance is provided by Signal Iduna.
Birthday gifts
Gift for new-born baby
Development and learning programs in accordance with your job description.
A monthly budget you can use to purchase flexible benefits through the Benefit platform.
Vacation vouchers for tourism in Romania reimbursed up to (max. RON 18.000/year)
Meal tickets
Private pension
Culture vouchers (for festivals, theatres, cinemas, bookshops etc.)
Courses and certifications according to your wishes (driving school, accounting, IT, foreign languages, etc.)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Adecco is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst, for one of its clients.




Responsibilities:

Collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets to support business decision-making.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using different tools (Excel / Power BI).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key performance metrics and deliver data-driven insights.
Extract data from various sources, clean and transform it for reporting and analysis.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to drive strategic initiatives.
Support data governance and ensure data accuracy and consistency across systems.
Assist in automating and optimizing data processes to improve efficiency.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or a similar role in a multinational company, within a multicultural environment.
Experience in FMCG or Tobacco industry is a nice to have.
Advanced English level.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI is a nice to have.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to translate raw data into business information
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present findings to stakeholders.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is the leading digital presence platform for multi-location brands, with thousands of customers worldwide. With one central platform, brands can seamlessly deliver consistent, accurate, and engaging experiences and meaningfully connect with customers anywhere in the digital world. Our AI and machine learning technology powers the knowledge behind every customer engagement, which is only possible through our team of innovators and enthusiastic collaborators. Join us and experience firsthand why we are consistently recognized as a ‘Best Place to Work’ globally by industry leaders such as Built In, Fortune, and Great Place To Work®!

We’re excited to share that Yext has recently joined forces with Hearsay Systems, forming a unified organization that is stronger than ever. This strategic acquisition enhances our ability to deliver world-class solutions by combining industry-leading digital presence management with compliant engagement solutions across social media, text, and voice. As we begin this exciting new chapter together, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to help us integrate and continue to innovate in our shared mission.

This role will be part of the Hearsay team, now an integral part of Yext.

This is a hybrid position, offering the flexibility of remote telework with the requirement to be on-site at least one day per week on average. Occasional adjustments may be made based on team needs or project demands.

This is a maternity cover position, estimated to last up to 18 months.

As a Data Analyst on the Value Consulting team, you’re passionate about translating a large volume of numbers into actionable business recommendations. Your work will help Yext customers and colleagues make more informed decisions; customers will better understand how to optimize their social media and compliant texting programs, and our company will continue learning how to better serve them in these efforts.

We’re looking for someone who has exceptional analytical skills, a passion for making customers successful, and a drive to get things done. Experience generating data insights that drive executive level stories and presentations is the core of this role, and your work will impact several teams, including your Value Consulting teammates, Customer Success Managers, Platform Reporting partners and Yext customers.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with CSMs to understand client needs, pull relevant data and generate visuals for key customer presentations
Work with various large reports to determine key actionable insights around data and user activity
Help drive data-backed “stories” – data analysis will drive key customer and company- level conclusions around areas of improvement, best practices, and program effectiveness
Determine industry-specific customer trends on social media effectiveness and end-user best practices
Work with internal Customer Success and Support data to find key improvement metrics on process and product
Help provide feedback to Hearsay Systems’ Product team on customer and company data needs
Collaborate with internal Value Consultants on data projects to help drive our customers’ ROI with Hearsay


What You Have


3+ years experience in a data-centric, analytical role
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to deliver multiple work streams on time with a high attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Superb Excel skills: data analysis, structured and unstructured data, charting and graphs
Excellent MS Powerpoint/Google Slides skills
Advanced knowledge of Looker or other data visualization tools
SQL skills a strong plus – pulling data from database directly to obtain necessary data
Strong attention to detail, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects


Yext is committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture where every person is seen, heard, and valued. We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Yext’s policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law. If you have a disability that requires an accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or participating in the employee selection process, please complete this form.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt een analytische mindset.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.




Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.




We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.







Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.




Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you.




We are looking for a

Data Analyst




Full Time | Amersfoort




As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.




You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.




Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.




In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.




What will you be doing:

Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business







What will you bring?

At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
Experience in building and maintaining data models
Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
Fluent in English




Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.




Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:

Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.




BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

Show more
HTML:
We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.


Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.


We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.



Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.


Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you.


We are looking for a

Data Analyst


Full Time | Amersfoort


As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.


You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.


Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.


In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.


What will you be doing:

  • Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
  • Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
  • Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
  • Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
  • Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business



What will you bring?

  • At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
  • Experience in building and maintaining data models
  • Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
  • Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
  • Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
  • Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
  • Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
  • Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
  • Fluent in English


Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.


Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:

Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.


BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A LBC é uma empresa de consultoria estratégica, transformação digital e de desenvolvimento de talento, com experiência em mais de 1.200 projetos em 18 países, 17 setores e 20 entidades multilaterais como o Banco Mundial, Programa das Nações Unidas para o Desenvolvimento, União Europeia, Banco Africano de Desenvolvimento, entre outros.

Requisitos


Licenciatura nas áreas de Gestão, Economia, Matemática, Estatística, Informática ou Gestão de Informação
3 anos de experiência em projetos de Data Analytics ou Business Intelligence
Experiência em projetos de Data Warehousing ou plataformas de business intelligence, Modelação de bases de dados, Bases de dados relacionais e NoSQL, Utilização de ferramentas ETL, Qualidade de Dados, Técnicas de Visualização e Reporting
Experiência em projetos com metodologias ágeis
Motivação, autonomia e rigor
Forte espírito de equipa e excelente capacidade colaborativa
Conhecimentos / Experiência em Python é valorizado
Conhecimentos / Experiência Hadoop e stack Apache relacionada, principalmente Kafka é valorizado
Conhecimentos / Experiência em Power BI é valorizado
Fluente em Português


Principais responsabilidades


Integração numa equipa multidisciplinar e participação em projetos de consultoria tecnológica
Apoio na implementação de novas fontes de informação e evolução de soluções inteligentes de gestão de dados
Análise e integração de dados relacionados com a atividade específica de cada cliente
Desenvolvimento de modelos de data quality
Desenvolvimento de modelos de sincronização de dados
Apoio na especificação funcional de soluções técnicas
Apoio no desenvolvimento e execução de testes
Colaboração direta com analistas de negócio, designers e developers


O que oferecemos


Uma oportunidade de trabalhar numa empresa líder e inovadora (premiada pela Revista Exame na categoria Digital Leaders 2023 e Melhores Empresas para Trabalhar)
Desenvolvimento contínuo de competências e carreira
Uma cultura de trabalho colaborativo e de apoio
Remuneração competitiva e pacote de benefícios


Candidata-te Já Pelo Nosso Site

The best future is the one you create and imagine for yourself

Title: Junior Data Analyst – 1-3 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – 1-3 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE!




Gain hands-on experience from day one
Work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau




Are you a recent graduate or early-career professional eager to build a strong foundation in data analysis? This is a unique opportunity to join a well-established Irish-owned company that values professional growth and provides a clear pathway to seniority.




We’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst with 1–3 years of experience ready to take the next step in their career. In this role, you’ll gain exposure to real-world business challenges, working across multiple functions to transform complex data into valuable insights that drive strategic decision-making.




Under the guidance of a highly experienced Senior Data Analyst, you’ll receive hands-on training in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau, mastering end-to-end data workflows while making a meaningful impact from day one. This is the perfect opportunity to fast-track your career towards a Senior Data Analyst role!




You will:

Analyse large, complex datasets to uncover key business insights.
Gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows.
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to influence data-driven decisions.
Receive direct mentorship and structured career development.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Experience in data extraction, transformation, and reporting using SQL.

Salary / Remuneration:

€25,000 - €35,000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.




We are hiring Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:




Minimum 8 10 years of IT experience and minimum 3 4 years of Analyst experience overall 5 years of Data Analyst experience
Advanced Business Analyst who has profound experience in doing data Analysis using SQL Knowing SAS Python is an added advantage
Well versed and comfortable in handling Huge Datasets
Good Analytical and problem-solving skills
Should be able to understand the Business terminologies and act as a very good barrier between Business and IT development team
Added advantage to have Functional background around Credit Risk
Independently Convert the Business requirements into High level and low level Solution design
Should be able to support in UT ST and end to end UAT testing
Good Analytical and problem solving skills
Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results
It is very important to have good communication skills and an agile team player




Mandatory Skills : MS Excel, PowerBI, Python, QlikView, Tableau

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer ground breaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.




Note that this vacancy is Remote, but our candidates must be based in Portugal.




We are looking for highly motivated and results orientated data analysts. Possessing proven expertise in Qlik Sense and potentially some Power BI knowledge. To leverage their skills to transform existing Power BI dashboards to Qlik Sense, ensuring the key purpose and insights required from the existing dashboards are available from the new Qlik Sense dashboards. They will work directly with senior members of the team and the Technical Team leader.

Specific Requirements

Certified or very experienced Qlik Sense user with demonstrable skills
An awareness of Power BI and AWS is beneficial
Exceptional ability to work with the business to understand the business process and reporting purpose
Excellent ability to translate existing data & dashboards requirements into effective new solutions
Optimal and efficient use of Qlik Sense to create visualizations; building sheets, create KPIs, build complex formulas, dynamic charts etc
Creates accurate, easy to digest/interpret solutions, adhering to internal guidelines
Collaborates effectively with the team to fill knowledge gaps and request support
Uses their initiative to problem solve
Proactively conducts test and validation of dashboard functionality & insights, ensuring data accuracy and integrity of the solution
Manages the UAT process by engaging with business users
Provides input and support to the wider team into best practice for report development
Engages with the wider team daily, scrum calls and meetings
Highly organised and well versed with agile development methodology
Exceptional analytical and time management skills
Exceptional communication skills




At Fujitsu, you will enjoy:

Competitive salary
Employment with the possibility of a permanent contract
Life insurance and private health insurance extensive to children for free and since first day of employment
Work life balance with part-time/full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
Several discounts available with our partners
Training and international career progression plan upon hiring
Dynamic and enthusiastic work environment with colleagues from more than 60 countries
The chance to get involved in our Social Responsibility program and participate in several initiatives with focus on wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, environment and our community (medical services, Yoga lessons, fresh fruit, volunteering afternoons)
Great Facilities at Central locations well served by public transportation, bicycle access and services
If you are moving to Portugal, we also offer the support of our Welcome Buddy to help you settle in.
Remote Working Available
An IKEA voucher to help you build your own home office
…and much more!

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Growth Opportunity!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Growth Opportunity!




Exciting Growth Opportunity
Learn from Industry Experts
Gain Hands-On Experience




*All Applicants must have STAMP 4 or EU Passport*




Are you a Junior Data Analyst eager to take your career to the next level? Join a well-established Irish company that truly invests in its people! This is a rare chance to work alongside senior professionals with over 20 years of experience, gaining mentorship, real-world exposure, and the skills to fast-track your growth.




In this role, you’ll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making, using AI-powered insights and mastering cutting-edge tools like SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, and Machine Learning.




You'll have the opportunity to take ownership of your projects and develop into a senior-level analyst over time!




You will:

Work with large datasets, using AI to improve efficiency and decision-making
Develop expertise in Power BI, Tableau, SQL to create impactful visualizations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize business strategies
Translate complex data into actionable insights for key stakeholders
Thrive in a dynamic environment with long-term career growth opportunities.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, and Tableau
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.







Salary / Remuneration:

€30.000 - €35.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/
