Title: Data Analyst (ESG) in Sustainability Office | SEB, Tallinn
Description:
SEB is a leading financial services group in Northern Europe, operating in over 20 countries worldwide. We are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to help drive impactful sustainability initiatives through lens of data. In this role, you will collaborate with various teams to develop ESG data solutions, provide insights, and support decision-making that advances SEB’s sustainability agenda. This is a unique opportunity to grow your expertise in ESG data within a financial institution which holds sustainability as its key strategical pillar. If you're eager to make your mark in advancing sustainability efforts in financial sector, this could be the role for you.

Join SEB Sustainability Office and accelerate the pace towards a sustainable future.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Managing ESG data across diverse areas, including sustainable finance, regulatory requirements, and risk management.
Assisting in ESG data collection, validation, and analysis for internal and external reporting.
Understanding business needs related to ESG data, compiling and analyzing datasets
Supporting the implementation and maintenance of ESG data tools and frameworks.
Assisting in the coordination of ESG data-related initiatives and projects.
Providing input in IT infrastructure development processes, including defining ESG-related data requirements.
Supporting other teams on ESG data-related inquiries and assisting in stakeholder communication.
Helping to comply with various data requirements (e.g. GDPR)


You Will Be a Great Fit If You Have


A strong interest in sustainability, particularly in financial sector.
Strong analytical skills and experience working with data, including structuring, processing, and interpreting datasets.
Experience with project coordination or working in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail and the ability to manage tasks in a structured manner.
A proactive mindset and willingness to contribute to the development of ESG data capabilities within SEB Baltics
Good communication skills and fluency in English (spoken and written).
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, R, SQL, or similar (considered an advantage).
Some knowledge of ESG-related regulations, sustainability reporting, or financial data analysis (considered an advantage).


We Offer


Extensive training and learning opportunities
Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
Possibilities to reskill by shifting areas/departments and location
A caring, supportive and respectful culture
Opportunities to help transform an industry


Do you want to be a part of SEB?

Welcome to join our inspiring culture and dedicated team distributed across the Baltic states and beyond.

We are looking forward to your English application by March 26, 2025.

Learn more about working at SEB https://www.seb.ee/en/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

The final offer (before tax deduction) will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate. Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.
Show more
HTML:
SEB is a leading financial services group in Northern Europe, operating in over 20 countries worldwide. We are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to help drive impactful sustainability initiatives through lens of data. In this role, you will collaborate with various teams to develop ESG data solutions, provide insights, and support decision-making that advances SEB’s sustainability agenda. This is a unique opportunity to grow your expertise in ESG data within a financial institution which holds sustainability as its key strategical pillar. If you're eager to make your mark in advancing sustainability efforts in financial sector, this could be the role for you.

Join SEB Sustainability Office and accelerate the pace towards a sustainable future.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

  • Managing ESG data across diverse areas, including sustainable finance, regulatory requirements, and risk management.
  • Assisting in ESG data collection, validation, and analysis for internal and external reporting.
  • Understanding business needs related to ESG data, compiling and analyzing datasets
  • Supporting the implementation and maintenance of ESG data tools and frameworks.
  • Assisting in the coordination of ESG data-related initiatives and projects.
  • Providing input in IT infrastructure development processes, including defining ESG-related data requirements.
  • Supporting other teams on ESG data-related inquiries and assisting in stakeholder communication.
  • Helping to comply with various data requirements (e.g. GDPR)

You Will Be a Great Fit If You Have

  • A strong interest in sustainability, particularly in financial sector.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience working with data, including structuring, processing, and interpreting datasets.
  • Experience with project coordination or working in cross-functional teams.
  • Attention to detail and the ability to manage tasks in a structured manner.
  • A proactive mindset and willingness to contribute to the development of ESG data capabilities within SEB Baltics
  • Good communication skills and fluency in English (spoken and written).
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, R, SQL, or similar (considered an advantage).
  • Some knowledge of ESG-related regulations, sustainability reporting, or financial data analysis (considered an advantage).

We Offer

  • Extensive training and learning opportunities
  • Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
  • Possibilities to reskill by shifting areas/departments and location
  • A caring, supportive and respectful culture
  • Opportunities to help transform an industry

Do you want to be a part of SEB?

Welcome to join our inspiring culture and dedicated team distributed across the Baltic states and beyond.

We are looking forward to your English application by March 26, 2025.

Learn more about working at SEB https://www.seb.ee/en/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

The final offer (before tax deduction) will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate. Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
At DSK Bank, we are seeking a motivated Junior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will provide the right candidate with an opportunity to grow their skills in business intelligence and data analysis, while contributing to our company's data-driven approach to decision making.


Main Responsibilities:


· Design and develop effective business intelligence dashboards using Power BI, focusing on clear and informative data visualization techniques to communicate insights to stakeholders;

· Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and relationships relevant to visualizations. Translate these insights into clear and actionable stories for audiences through data visualization;

· Partner with business stakeholders to understand their needs and objectives. Translate those needs into compelling data visualizations that effectively communicate insights;

· Prepare data for visualization by wrangling and cleaning datasets from Oracle databases. Write SQL queries to extract relevant data for visualizations;


Ideal Candidate:


  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field;
  • Experience: Proven experience in data visualization, business intelligence (BI) development, data science, or a relevant role involving data management;
  • Technical Skills: Hands-on experience with BI technologies, specifically Power BI. Writing SQL queries, particularly for Oracle databases, is a strong advantage;
  • Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and a meticulous eye for detail. Ability to thrive in a collaborative team environment. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively translate data insights to stakeholders;


We offer:


  • Excellent opportunities for professional and career development in one of Bulgaria’s leading banks;
  • Food vouchers in the amount up to 200 BGN per month;
  • 20 + 5 paid holiday leave;
  • Additional Health Insurance;
  • Favorable conditions for housing and mortgage lending, as well as for bank products and services;
  • Preferences for bank products and services;
  • Annual bonus scheme depending on the achieved results;
  • Preferential conditions for Multisport / CoolFit card;
  • Great location – in the heart of Sofia’s city center;
  • Discounts in various companies;
  • Refer a Friend Bonus.



If you are looking for a career where you can apply your passion for data, grow your skills, and contribute to the success of a leading bank, we would love to hear from you!


Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. All applications will be treated in confidentiality.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
PROS, Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: PRO) provides AI-powered solutions that optimize selling in the digital economy. PROS solutions make it possible for companies to price, configure and sell their products and services in an omnichannel environment with speed, precision and consistency. Our customers, who are leaders in their markets, benefit from decades of data science expertise infused into our industry solutions.


A key responsibility of the Junior Data Analyst role is to assist in creating data visualizations that enable our team and customers to view, question, analyze, and interpret data to understand relationships, patterns, and trends. This individual will leverage relevant technology and visualization techniques to make information accessible and intuitive.


This role will interact with other data analysts, tracking manager, developers, project and product managers, quality engineering and customer success managers.

The Data Analyst will be working with very large amounts of dynamic data, therefore experience in big-data environments is a big plus.

Our ideal candidate has an analytical mind, a natural curiosity to solve problems, and an interest in the digital world.


A Day in the Life of the Junior Data Analyst – About the role:

Responsibilities:

Synthesize industry dashboards;

  • Assist in rolling-out the Customer Reporting Suite to new customers;
  • Analyze and share data to help business teams drive improvement in key business metrics, customer experience, and business results; this could be achieved via the internal Data Analytics newsletter;
  • Ensures the collected data is within required quality standards;
  • May train customers in the use of the business intelligence tools to enhance business decision-making capability;


Required Qualifications – About you:

Must be proficient:

  • Programming: SQL
  • Visualization tools: Tableau, PowerBI, Looker Data Studio;
  • Demonstrated experience in creating dashboards and visualizations representing complex information that can be actioned on in an impactful way;


Desired Qualifications:

  • Degree: Bachelor’s degree in data analytics, computer science, information systems, statistics, or a related field.
  • Certifications: Google Data Analytics Certificate, Tableau Desktop Specialist or Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate
  • Knowledge of analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics)
  • Familiarity with Google Big Query (GBQ)
  • Familiarity with Amazon Redshift


Expected Soft Skills:

  • Excellent communication skills and proven ability to work with analysts, engineers, development, leadership and clients towards a common goal;
  • Skilled in identifying data inconsistencies and applying standard solutions to ensure accuracy;
  • Operates with a high degree of autonomy and accountability;
  • Demonstrates the initiative to explore current industry trends and best practices and learns new methods and techniques to integrate for improved outcomes;
  • Strong organizational skills and detail-oriented;


Skills & Personal Characteristics:

  • Ownership
  • Innovation
  • Care

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Greetings,

We at TST Infotech have this urgent job opening for one of our valued customer, please let us know if you are interested for this role and share your updated CV along with B2B salary to proceed for this job opening.

Job Details

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Krakow, Poland (Onsite 2 days/week)

Mode: B2B contract through TST Infotech

Note - Candidates holding valid work permit and located in Poland are requested to apply for this opening.

Ability to bond and collaborate across functions and businesses (in particular with other Risk and Finance teams, businesses and IT)


Best Regards and thank you,

Vivek Kumar

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and transform raw data into meaningful datasets for analysis.
Conduct detailed analyses to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within IT operations and other business functions.
Build and maintain dashboards and visualizations to present key metrics and insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with IT teams, project managers, and business units to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions.
Support IT project planning and execution by analyzing historical data and forecasting future trends.
Prepare clear and concise reports summarizing analytical findings for technical and non-technical audiences.
Present insights to management to support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure data integrity, security, and accuracy by adhering to company standards and data governance policies.
Maintain documentation for data sources, analysis processes, and report generation.




Key Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the IT or technology sector.
Proficient in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages for data analysis.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.




We take data privacy seriously and are committed to ensuring that your personal information is handled in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).




As part of our hiring process, the information you provide, including your email address, will be used solely for internal purposes. This may include communication regarding your application, interview scheduling, and relevant updates. Additionally, your email may be used for internal marketing communications, such as company news or job-related updates. However, we want to assure you that your data will never be sold or shared with third parties.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
Qui sommes-nous ? 🧐




AWAKE Group accélère les innovations responsables et environnementales dans l’industrie. 🌱




AWAKE Group, c’est :

d’un côté INNOVATEAM, acteur de référence du conseil en ingénierie
de l’autre AWAKE, notre expertise dédiée aux projets à forte valeur ajoutée environnementale et responsable, qui se déploie en Belgique et en France. 🇫🇷🇧🇪




En tant qu’ingénieurs, nous contribuons à façonner le monde en participant aux grandes avancées technologiques, en révolutionnant les secteurs suivants :

🚆Smart Mobility ☀️New Energies & Infrastructures 💻Connectivity & Data 🔬Healthcare 🌎Defence & Space




De cette responsabilité en découle une autre 👉 assumer à notre niveau l’impact du progrès sur notre planète et agir pour en limiter les effets indésirables.




AWAKE Group c’est une équipe jeune, dynamique et engagée ! Tes futurs collaborateurs sont super (la preuve : nous sommes accrédités HappyIndex@AtWork depuis 9 années consécutives !) 🤩




INNOVATEAM est à la recherche d'un Data Analyst Power BI (H/F) pour l'un de nos partenaires à Valognes (50).




A propos du poste 🧐




Missions :




Structurer et automatiser les bases de données : Optimisation et mise en place de processus automatisés pour améliorer la gestion des données sous Power BI.
Développer et optimiser les tableaux de bord : Création de visualisations pertinentes pour faciliter l’analyse des données et la prise de décision.
Assurer la fiabilité et la cohérence des données : Vérification des sources, mise en place de contrôles et résolution des anomalies éventuelles.
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers : Compréhension des besoins, définition des indicateurs clés et accompagnement à l’utilisation des outils développés.




Profil recherché :




Formation et Expérience : Bac+3 à Bac+5 avec une spécialisation en analyse de données, BI ou informatique décisionnelle. Première expérience significative en data analysis, idéalement avec Power BI.
Compétences Techniques : Compétences en modélisation, DAX, SQL et structuration de données.




Toutes nos offres sont ouvertes aux personnes en situation de handicap.




Les petits + ✨

En nous rejoignant, tu gagnes plusieurs avantages :

🍃 Rejoindre une société qui compense entièrement ton empreinte carbone #Ingenieur&Citoyen

⚡️Bénéficier de 180 euros par an sur notre plateforme TeamStarter pour créer les afterworks et teambuildings de ton choix

🥇 Une des meilleures mutuelles du marché

💼 Un plan de carrière sur-mesure grâce à votre manager et votre HR Partner

😀 De la bonne humeur et de super events tout au long de l’année !

Title: Analista de Datos con PowerBI
Description:
Buscamos un Analista de Datos altamente motivado y experimentado para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data Science.




Como Anañista de Datos, serás responsable de analizar grandes volúmenes de datos, extraer patrones y crear modelos predictivos que ayuden a mejorar nuestras decisiones estratégicas.




Tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos dinámicos que impactan directamente en el negocio y en la toma de decisiones a nivel global.




Responsabilidades:




· Recopilar, limpiar y organizar grandes conjuntos de datos estructurados y no estructurados.

· Desarrollar modelos de machine learning y algoritmos predictivos.

· Realizar análisis estadísticos y generar informes detallados para comunicar los resultados de manera efectiva.

· Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios para identificar oportunidades de análisis de datos en diversas áreas del negocio.

· Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y fáciles de entender para los líderes de la empresa.

· Mejorar los procesos existentes mediante el uso de técnicas avanzadas de modelado y análisis.

· Desarrollar y mantener bases de datos eficientes y escalables.

Show more

Title: Junior Consultant Data Analytics/Science
Description:
Your benefits




Corporate Benefits: You will receive a best-in-class benefits package including, for example, an electric lease car or mobility budget, laptop & mobile phone, work from home budget, 25 holidays + optional to buy 5 days extra a year and pension contributions.
Flexible Working: Your plans are as unique as you are. Choose your place of work flexibly – whether in one of our office locations or remotely.
Mentorship: Experienced colleagues will support you during your start and development.
Personal Development: Look forward to responsible tasks with a high degree of creative freedom, a steep learning curve, and an extensive range of training courses.
Team Spirit: We embrace flat hierarchies and a team-oriented corporate culture. Ecological responsibility and social commitment are part of our DNA.
Remuneration Model: Benefit from our attractive model, including a performance-related bonus.
Work-Life Balance: We offer a wide range of options, including sabbaticals and workcations.







Your future tasks




As a (senior) Analyst Data Science or Analytics you collaborate with clients and team members to analyze data, create valuable visualizations, and develop data-driven recommendations.

Furthermore;

Experience in data science and analytics.
Strong problem-solving skills and a fresh perspective on projects.
Setting up ETL pipelines for data processing.
Designing and developing data storage using cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Applying machine learning and AI techniques to create value for companies.







Your profile




Master's degree in Mathematics, Physics, Econometrics, Operational Research, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field with a strong focus on statistics.
Affinity with data processing, data visualization, data analytics, and AI.
Familiarity with tools and techniques for processing and visualizing data (R, Python, PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik Sense, Git, SQL) or willingness to learn these in your first months.
Experience with cloud services such as AWS, Azure, GCP, Databricks, and Snowflake is a plus.
Independence, proactivity, and strong communication skills in both Dutch and English.




Together, we are more than Business

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and global reach. We offer consulting that combines strategy with technology and combine entrepreneurship with a spirit of innovation.

You make the difference: We give you the space to be yourself and develop your full potential. Regardless of where you come from, what you believe in or who you love. We stand up for equal opportunities and diversity.




Research shows that female candidates only apply when they meet 100% of the requirements and male candidates as early as 60%. So if you recognize yourself in the challenge and at least some of the requirements, don't hesitate. We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker
Show more
HTML:
EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities

  • Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
  • Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
  • Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
  • Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
  • Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion

Required Qualifications

  • 2 years experience
  • Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
  • Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
  • Some knowledge and experience working with Python
  • Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker

Title: Data Analyst con Power BI
Description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo! 🔎




¿Buscas un nuevo reto donde desarrollar tu carrera y aprender nuevas tecnologías? Entonces sigue leyendo porque esto te puede interesar.




Scalian es una empresa de más de 6.000 personas con una dimensión internacional, con oficinas en Europa y América del Norte. Estamos especializados en dar servicios a diferentes clientes enfocados en Data, Cloud e Inteligencia Artificial.




¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de profesionales de Scalian. Dentro de este rol estarás desarrollando las siguientes funciones:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Colaborar estrechamente con el Data Engineering Lead y su equipo para garantizar que los modelos de datos sean óptimos para el reporting.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de diseño de visualizaciones para asegurar claridad, accesibilidad y usabilidad.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




Requisitos mínimos:

Sólidos conocimientos puestos en práctica con Power BI.
Experiencia y conocimiento de DAX.
Fluidez escrita y hablada en inglés.
Valorable tener certificaciones de Power BI.




¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

🚀 Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

💻 Modalidad 100% teletrabajo

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 After works en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.




¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!




Impactful projects from day one
Accelerate your career
Data-driven decision-making




Join a well-established, Irish-owned company that invests in its people for the long term! As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be hands-on from the very first day, working with large datasets across multiple business functions to provide critical insights that shape the company's strategy.




This is a rare opportunity to follow end-to-end workflows, gaining a deep understanding of how data drives business success while developing expertise in SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Machine Learning.




If you're looking for a broad, hands-on role where you can work across multiple domains, integrate AI-driven insights, and develop into an independent and vital component of the organization, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




You will:

Work with complex datasets to improve business efficiency and decision-making.
Gain exposure to end-to-end workflows, understanding how data supports key business functions.
Master industry-leading visualization tools – Power BI, Tableau, and Excel.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, delivering insights to key stakeholders.
Develop into a self-sufficient data expert, playing a crucial role in business success




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, and Tableau
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.




Salary / Remuneration:

€25.000 - €40.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

About Archer – Archer Recruitment is a Specialist IT Recruitment

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
POUR VOUS, TOUT COMMENCE ICI !




Envie de faire vraiment la différence dans les projets de vie de vos clients et de relever tous les challenges qui s’offrent à vous ? Oui ? Alors, vous êtes au bon endroit pour cela !




Dans le cadre de son développement, le Crédit Agricole d’Aquitaine recherche pour son équipe Data, un Data Analyst H/F. Vous collaborerez avec les équipes métiers et IT pour transformer les besoins business en analyses concrètes et recommandations stratégiques. Votre rôle sera essentiel pour transformer les données brutes en informations exploitables, permettant ainsi de prendre des décisions stratégiques éclairées.




Tout le monde connaît le Crédit Agricole ! Vraiment ? 1er financeur de l’économie française, nous sommes aussi la Banque Universelle de Proximité et nos 2772 collaborateurs dans 242 agences et sièges agissent dans l’intérêt de nos clients et celui de la société avec proximité, responsabilité et solidarité.




SOYEZ ENGAGÉS avec nous ! Vos principales MISSIONS :




En collaboration étroite avec les équipes métiers (par exemple : pilotage commercial, assurances, crédits, risques), il/elle traduit les besoins business en analyses concrètes et en recommandations ​stratégiques, grâce à des visualisations percutantes et des indicateurs clairs :​




Collecte et préparation de données : collecter, nettoyer et structurer les données issues de différentes sources (CRM, Webtracking, Open Data, Filiales, API, …), et garantir leur qualité, cohérence et fiabilité pour les analyses​
Analyses exploratoires : identifier des tendances, corrélations et anomalies dans les données, et répondre aux problématiques métiers en fournissant des analyses claires et des enseignements exploitables​
Conception de tableaux de bord et rapports : développer des tableaux de bord interactifs pour suivre des KPI et aider au pilotage des activités, et automatiser les rapports récurrents pour les équipes métiers et la direction​
Accompagnement à la prise de décision : collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour transformer les enseignements en actions concrètes​
Veille technologique et innovation : identifier des opportunités d’optimisation dans les processus existants grâce aux données et rester à jour sur les outils et technique d’analyse de données ​







Package de rémunération : votre travail crée notre valeur : salaire à partir de 3300 euros brut par mois, rémunération variable, 13ème mois, prime d’intéressement, de participation.
Avantages adaptés à votre quotidien : l’équilibre vie privée, vie professionnelle chez nous, c’est important : 25 jours de congés payés, RTT, jours de télétravail. Bien sûr, tickets restaurants, mutuelle et prévoyance font parties intégrante du package.
Etre là pour vous à chaque étape : vous êtes notre priorité. Dès les premiers jours, nous sommes là en vous proposant un parcours d’intégration.
87% des collaborateurs se disent fiers de travailler pour le Crédit Agricole.




Et si c’était vous notre futur collègue ?




Nous sommes engagés au quotidien pour l’égalité des chances, en valorisant chaque talent. Depuis 2006, nous sommes fiers de notre engagement en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap.




Profil :




Vous êtes issu(e) d'une formation BAC+5 en statistiques, mathématiques, et/ou informatique décisionnelle et vous disposez d’une expérience d’1 à 3 ans dans un poste similaire, idéalement dans un environnement bancaire.




Compétences techniques :




Maîtrise des langages de programmation et des bases de données : SQL (requêtes avancées et optimisation), Python pour l’analyse est un plus
Maîtrise d’outils de manipulation de données : SAS, BO, SQL Server
Maîtrise d’outils de visualisation de données : Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, Microstrategy serait un plus
Connaissance des bases relationnelles et des data warehouses (Hive de préférence)
Connaissance des concepts de base en analyse statistique (régressions, tests d’hypothèse, intervalle de confiance, …)

Compétences métiers et relationnelles :




Capacité à comprendre des enjeux métiers et à aligner les solutions data avec les objectifs stratégiques
Excellentes compétences en communication pour vulgariser des résultats complexes
Esprit analytique, curiosité et capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes
Capacité à travailler en équipe dans des environnements pluridisciplinaires
Organisation et gestion des priorités dans des projets multi-tâches
Proactivité et autonomie







Les données personnelles recueillies par la présente, par le Crédit Agricole d’Aquitaine, en qualité de Responsable de traitement sont nécessaires pour étudier votre candidature. Elles seront conservées pendant une durée de 18 mois et ne seront donc pas utilisées pour d’autres finalités.

Nous vous invitons également à consulter la Charte de protection des données personnelles des candidats du Groupe Crédit Agricole disponible sur l’intranet de recrutement du Groupe à l’adresse suivante : https://www.groupecreditagricole.jobs/Charte-Candidats

Et si c’était vous notre futur collègue ?


Nous sommes engagés au quotidien pour l’égalité des chances, en valorisant chaque talent. Depuis 2006, nous sommes fiers de notre engagement en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap.


Profil :

Compétences techniques :


  • Maîtrise des langages de programmation et des bases de données : SQL (requêtes avancées et optimisation), Python pour l’analyse est un plus
  • Maîtrise d’outils de manipulation de données : SAS, BO, SQL Server
  • Maîtrise d’outils de visualisation de données : Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, Microstrategy serait un plus
  • Connaissance des bases relationnelles et des data warehouses (Hive de préférence)
  • Connaissance des concepts de base en analyse statistique (régressions, tests d’hypothèse, intervalle de confiance, …)

Compétences métiers et relationnelles :


  • Capacité à comprendre des enjeux métiers et à aligner les solutions data avec les objectifs stratégiques
  • Excellentes compétences en communication pour vulgariser des résultats complexes
  • Esprit analytique, curiosité et capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe dans des environnements pluridisciplinaires
  • Organisation et gestion des priorités dans des projets multi-tâches

Title: Data Analyst Junior H/F
Description:
DREAM ENERGY et ARTESOL filiales du groupe ARTEA, sont des entreprises engagées dans la transition énergétique, axées sur le développement et la mise en œuvre de solutions innovantes dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables, l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique. Avec une vision centrée sur la durabilité et la préservation de l'environnement, elles s'efforcent de proposer des technologies efficaces et respectueuses de la planète. Grâce à son expertise dans les énergies solaire et hydraulique, les filiales cherchent à répondre aux défis actuels liés au changement climatique en offrant des solutions viables et à fort impact environnemental.

En collaboration avec les ingénieurs et les responsables opérationnels, vous aurez à charge de concevoir les outils permettant l’amélioration des analyses de données sur l’ensemble des métiers du Groupe, à savoir l’énergie (centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques, hydrogène, biogaz), l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique (infrastructures de recharge AC / DC pour véhicules électriques).




MISSIONS

Dans ce contexte, vous occupez le poste de Data Analyst Junior H/F et vos principales missions seront les suivantes :




Collecte et gestion des données

Assurer la remontée et le stockage des données issues de nos centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques et infrastructures de recharge pour véhicules électriques.
Contribuer à la gestion et l’optimisation des bases de données (Cloud ou Serveur physique).

Analyse et visualisation

Exploiter les données pour identifier des tendances et améliorer la performance énergétique.
Mettre en place des tableaux de bord et indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) avec Power BI ou Excel.
Participer à l’élaboration de rapports analytiques sur les performances des installations.

Développement et automatisation

Aider à la conception d’outils facilitant le traitement et la croisée des bases de données.
Participer à l’intégration de données externes (météo, prix de l’électricité, etc.) pour affiner les analyses.
Contribuer au développement et à l'amélioration des API pour l’exploitation des données.




PROFIL RECHERCHE




Formation : Bac+5 en école d’ingénieur ou université avec spécialisation en Data Science, Informatique ou Énergie.

Compétences :

Maîtrise d’Excel (VBA souhaité).
Connaissance en SQL, Python et/ou Power BI.
Bonnes compétences analytiques et capacité à manipuler de grandes bases de données.
Esprit rigoureux, autonome et curieux.
Bon niveau d’anglais écrit et oral.




CONDITIONS D’EMPLOI

CDI 39h/semaine
1 RTT/mois
Tickets restaurants
Statut : Cadre
Rémunération : selon expérience

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!




Hands-on projects from day one
Work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst
Gain expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau




Are you a data-driven professional eager to accelerate your career? Join a well-established Irish-owned company that prioritizes long-term career development! This is a rare opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to work across multiple business functions, delivering key insights that drive strategic decision-making.




In this role, you'll collaborate with a Senior Data Analyst, gaining exposure to end-to-end data workflows while honing your skills in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau. You'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making, helping optimize business efficiency and integrating AI-driven insights.




If you're looking for a role where you can grow, learn from experienced professionals, and make a real impact from day one, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




You will:

Work with large, complex datasets to provide valuable business insights.
Gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows.
Develop expertise in Power BI, Tableau, and Excel.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-led decisions.
Learn in a supportive environment with guidance from a Senior Data Analyst.




Skills/Experience:

2–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, and Tableau
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.
Strong SQL expertise with proven experience in data extraction and transformation.




Salary / Remuneration:

€25,000 - €40,000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.

If you're looking for a role where you can grow, learn from experienced professionals, and make a real impact from day one, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.




Job Description




Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success




Job Purpose




As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.




Main Duties:




Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor’s Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures







Qualifications




Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment




What We Offer:




A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.




Additional Information




If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.




Location and Availability Requirements:




Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm




Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS




What It’s Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona

Title: Data Analyst - Python
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into an Analytics Manager within the Product Development team you will focus on data analyses. Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical and spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and resolving problems using data.

This is a role for someone with a numerical or data analysis background to play an important part in an exciting area of the Experian business!

What you'll do?


You will deliver analytical projects which will involve analysing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data.
Knowledge of the digital landscape (e.g. Building audiences and delivering insights)
Support shaping and refinement of projects.
Provide mentoring to Analysts in the team.
Ensure knowledge transfer of analysis (interpretation; justification; methods).
Be an escalation point for analysts to support their work.
Ensure all work is process checked and sense checked following team checking guidelines.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Experienced user of at least one analytical program, such as R, Python and SAS/WPS or equivalent.
Experience using Java, Scala, R or Python within Apache Spark.
Worked with distributed file systems (such as HDFS)
Proficient in the use of MS excel (can perform complex functions).
Experience interpreting analysis outputs, providing insight and making recommendations.


Desirable


Knowledge of the digital landscape (e.g. Building audiences and delivering insights)
Experience using Linux OS
End-to-end data automation
Proficient in advanced analytical methods, such as modelling and segmentation.
Degree with high mathematical / technical / analytical content


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

3 to 5 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another




* A personality assessment is part of the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!

We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of “large company” in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.




Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a “Lifetime Experience” where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.

#welcometoyourfuture




What you need to have/know:

Strong knowledge in SQL 🛠️
Proficient in Power BI 📊, Power Query, and M Language 🔄
Expertise in DAX for data modeling 💡




What we expect from you:

Ability to work independently and as part of a team 🤝
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail 🔍
Passion for data and turning insights into action 🚀




What would be a plus (optional):

ETL Development experience 🔄
Knowledge of Python / R 🐍📈
Familiarity with VBA 💻
Advanced skills in Excel 📊




Language Skills:

English (minimum B2 level)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ( 1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Lisbon (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Karo Healthcare, a dynamic and growing company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A. Since 2019, under EQT ownership, we're rapidly heading towards a €1 billion European leadership position in consumer health.

Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a Business and Data Analyst for our office in Stockholm.


Roles and responsibilities

Ensuring Business-Relevant Data & Decision Support

Act as the bridge between business and technology, ensuring data solutions align with business needs
Define and structure data to support decision-making across Commercial, Marketing, Finance, and Operations
Provide insights and recommendations to improve performance and efficiency
Align reporting standards, KPIs, and data definitions across global and regional teams

Power BI Report Development & Data Visualization

Design and develop user-friendly, actionable Power BI dashboards tailored to business needs
Ensure dashboards provide clear, relevant insights that help users make informed decisions
Focus on intuitive design and usability, making it easy for stakeholders to interpret and act on data
Work closely with end users to understand their needs and ensure dashboards provide the right level of detail
Optimize reports for performance, accessibility, and scalability, ensuring adoption across the organization
Collaborate with Power BI developers and data engineers to maintain seamless data integration

Managing a Complex Data Landscape

Support data governance by improving data reliability and structure
Help define data ownership, quality processes, and standardized reporting frameworks
Work with business and digital teams to address data inconsistencies and improve integrity

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Change Management

Partner with business and digital teams to align reporting and analytics needs
Translate complex data concepts into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders
Promote self-service analytics and train business users on Power BI best practices
Drive a data-driven culture, ensuring teams use data effectively in decision-making



Requirements



Experience & Background

3+ years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or a similar role
Previous experience working in a data-driven organization within consumer healthcare, FMCG, or a related industry is a plus
Hands-on experience with Power BI, including dashboard development, data modeling, and visualization best practices
Strong track record of working cross-functionally with stakeholders in Commercial, Marketing, Finance, Operations, and IT
Experience with data governance, data management, and ensuring data quality
Knowledge of SQL, DAX, or Power Query is an advantage

Education

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering or Computer Science
Additional certifications in Power BI, Data Analytics, or Business Intelligence are a plus

Personal characteristics

Business Acumen & Data Analysis - Ability to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions
Power BI & Data Visualization - Expertise in creating user-friendly, insightful, and action-oriented dashboards
Data Governance & Quality - Strong understanding of data management, ownership, and ensuring accurate reporting
Communication & Stakeholder Engagement - Ability to bridge the gap between business and technology, ensuring alignment
Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking - Ability to identify challenges, analyse data, and provide actionable recommendations
Project & Change Management - Capable of leading and supporting analytics-driven transformation initiatives




Benefits


Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
Flexible schedule and life work balance
Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values

Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.

Show more
HTML:
Karo Healthcare, a dynamic and growing company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A. Since 2019, under EQT ownership, we're rapidly heading towards a €1 billion European leadership position in consumer health.

Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a Business and Data Analyst for our office in Stockholm.

Roles and responsibilities

Ensuring Business-Relevant Data & Decision Support

  • Act as the bridge between business and technology, ensuring data solutions align with business needs
  • Define and structure data to support decision-making across Commercial, Marketing, Finance, and Operations
  • Provide insights and recommendations to improve performance and efficiency
  • Align reporting standards, KPIs, and data definitions across global and regional teams

Power BI Report Development & Data Visualization

  • Design and develop user-friendly, actionable Power BI dashboards tailored to business needs
  • Ensure dashboards provide clear, relevant insights that help users make informed decisions
  • Focus on intuitive design and usability, making it easy for stakeholders to interpret and act on data
  • Work closely with end users to understand their needs and ensure dashboards provide the right level of detail
  • Optimize reports for performance, accessibility, and scalability, ensuring adoption across the organization
  • Collaborate with Power BI developers and data engineers to maintain seamless data integration

Managing a Complex Data Landscape

  • Support data governance by improving data reliability and structure
  • Help define data ownership, quality processes, and standardized reporting frameworks
  • Work with business and digital teams to address data inconsistencies and improve integrity

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Change Management

  • Partner with business and digital teams to align reporting and analytics needs
  • Translate complex data concepts into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders
  • Promote self-service analytics and train business users on Power BI best practices
  • Drive a data-driven culture, ensuring teams use data effectively in decision-making


Requirements

Experience & Background

  • 3+ years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or a similar role
  • Previous experience working in a data-driven organization within consumer healthcare, FMCG, or a related industry is a plus
  • Hands-on experience with Power BI, including dashboard development, data modeling, and visualization best practices
  • Strong track record of working cross-functionally with stakeholders in Commercial, Marketing, Finance, Operations, and IT
  • Experience with data governance, data management, and ensuring data quality
  • Knowledge of SQL, DAX, or Power Query is an advantage

Education

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering or Computer Science
  • Additional certifications in Power BI, Data Analytics, or Business Intelligence are a plus

Personal characteristics

  • Business Acumen & Data Analysis - Ability to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions
  • Power BI & Data Visualization - Expertise in creating user-friendly, insightful, and action-oriented dashboards
  • Data Governance & Quality - Strong understanding of data management, ownership, and ensuring accurate reporting
  • Communication & Stakeholder Engagement - Ability to bridge the gap between business and technology, ensuring alignment
  • Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking - Ability to identify challenges, analyse data, and provide actionable recommendations
  • Project & Change Management - Capable of leading and supporting analytics-driven transformation initiatives



Benefits

  • Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
  • Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
  • Flexible schedule and life work balance
  • Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
  • Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
  • Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values

Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

The role of the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst plays an essential part within the global BI team that supports Global Finance Services. Reporting to the BI Manager, the BI Analyst will focus on the development, delivery and maintenance of analytics solutions to support informed decision-making, better control over operations and provide transparency performance metrics.

What you'll do?


Desig reports that answer business questions/requirements and make the most of our visualization tools capabilities
Lead by example by designing powerful user-focused content following our design standards
Lead the development cycle of assigned projects
Provision of clear status updates about expected deadlines
Continue to develop your knowledge of management information tools and techniques, and share this knowledge with your team and across our users
Participate in discussions with senior leaders regarding relevant technical matters
Provide technical expertise on the relevant tools where required to the support team in troubleshooting, in discussions with the vendor, senior management and internal IT teams


Qualifications

What you'll bring?


2+ years practical experience developing reports with Tableau Desktop and Prep
Technical IT degree preferred or other relevant qualification
Knowledge of data visualization best practice and trends, UX mindset
And ability to present to senior stakeholders
Experience within challenging, dynamic, matrix-based management structures
Knowledge of trends and latest possibilities in MI/BI, data and automation
Mindset of innovation and process improvement, ability to lead changes
Fluent English


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt een analytische mindset.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.
